text: now our next question comes from Nick
Starling and Monique sent abroad for a
study abroad trip and she's asking mark
how much money should I bring the thing
is when you're looking at the kind of
money to bring with you when you're
going to study abroad what I kind of
look at it is you're going to spend
about the same amount of money that you
do at home okay in terms of the food and
lodging and stuff like that usually
schools in Europe and around the world
have relatively affordable accommodation
for students or you go living in a vague
AR Volga mine shop in Germany we have
you know four or five people living
together an apartment and you will be
kind of saving money that way so I kind
of look at it almost as the same price
as living in the US when you do study
abroad where you will spend a lot of the
extra money is on the travel so if
you're going to be flying around Europe
or flying around Southeast Asia you're
going to need a hundred bucks for two
hundred bucks or three hundred bucks to
be where you're going to go and you're
flying around for those weekend trips so
make sure you do have that extra cash
and that's why I say before you go
abroad look and see the kind of places
you want to go while you're there so you
can kind of plan those out so maybe
you've booked the tickets earlier to
save yourself some money and that can
help you out okay so you're going to
spend about the same amount of money as
if you're at at school at home just know
that you'll spend more money overall
though because you'll probably go travel
and do those things if you stay in your
local area when you're studying abroad
you're probably going out to school
college parties and stuff like that and
that's a lot cheaper than traveling so
so that's one thing now
